revised_title: Fas Ligand and Fas: Regulating Cell Death through Apoptosis
tldr: The article discusses the Fas ligand and Fas receptor system, which play a crucial role in regulating cell death through apoptosis. The Fas receptor is a member of the tumor necrosis factor (TNF)/nerve growth factor (NGF) receptor family and is involved in various physiological processes. The Fas ligand, a death factor, binds to the Fas receptor, leading to cell death or apoptosis. This process is essential for maintaining tissue homeostasis and preventing the development of malignancy.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
